item.text: Referred to the Committee on the Judiciary. (text of measure as introduced: CR S8065)

item.name: Social work, volunteer service, charitable organizations

summary.text:
Commends the staff and volunteers of the Children's Home Society of America for the dedication and commitment of the Children's Home Society of America to the children and families of the United States.

Recognizes the Society for leveraging human, financial, and material resources to carry out the mission of the Society of helping children and families to remain safe, healthy, and prepared for life.

Encourages the continued efforts of the staff of the Society on behalf of children and families.

bill.title: A resolution commending the Children's Home Society of America.

item.title: A resolution commending the Children's Home Society of America.
A resolution commending the Children's Home Society of America.

latestAction.text: Referred to the Committee on the Judiciary. (text of measure as introduced: CR S8065)

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
